message: For instance, I have a couple groups send me emails when new topics are created.  I don't have any way to tell which group created the topic, though until I open the email up.
The subtitle is "bug and issue tracking"
whether klochner created it is irrelevant to me if it's in a group on GitHub or a group on Fuzzy Bunny Slippers
If the email contained some indication (either in the from name or the subject) in what group it belonged to, I could at least parse out which ones I care about
I have 5 or 6 emails right now that have new topics, none of the belonging to the same group
I care what the topic is about
whether I can provide input, would be interested in reading about, etc,. etc.

Also, why is this the first line in an email from a group?

"klochner has created a new topic in GitHub"
All in all, I find the emails dissatisfying to say the least.

I know I can't be the only one that sees a whole bunch of emails from convore that just say the topic "glitch with fuzzyfinder" or "bug and issue tracking" and wonder which group I'm supposed to correlate it to
that should be more prominent in the email than who created it
and foremost, the header line should mention the group first
